thread.title: Devon's Geoffrey Cox MP tipped to be named Brexit secretary - Live updates and reaction - Devon Live

author: Joel Cooper
title: Devon's Geoffrey Cox MP tipped to be named Brexit secretary - Live updates and reaction - Devon Live
text:
Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
He's the wealthy Devon MP whose booming voice and dramatic oratory shot him to internet stardom following the Conservative Party Conference in September.
But is Geoffrey Cox about to start another leading role in Theresa May's government?
Following Dominic Raab's shock resignation yesterday, the job of the new Brexit secretary is up for grabs - and Cox's name is among those being talked about on the grape vine. Read More
Of course, there are several other potential candidates being mooted too - including Michael Gove, Liam Fox, Andrea Leadsom and Penny Mordaunt. Geoffrey Cox (Image: PA)
But Cox - who is MP for Torridge and West Devon as well as the Attorney General in Theresa May's cabinet - has been tipped by many to take the role, with rumours circulating that an announcement could be made soon.
In September, Cox hit the headlines after his amusing and "booming" speech at the Conservative Party Conference made him an internet hit.
Hi voice was compared to that Brian Blessed or Mufasa, the Lion King played by James Earl Jones. Read More
Were he to be named Brexit secretary, he would be the third person to take on the role. David Davis quit earlier this year and was followed yesterday by Dominic Raab.
Stay tuned to our live blog below for all the latest information: 15:09 Who is Geoffrey Cox? Geoffrey Cox, Torridge and West Devon MP
Geoffrey Cox has become a rising star in the Brexit negotiation and has been tipped to be the next Brexit Secretary replacing Dominic Raab.
The Devon barrister has been MP for Torridge and West Devon since 2005 and is said to be the highest earning MP in the House of Commons, thanks to his other role as a QC.
On July 9, 2018 he was appointed Attorney General and at the Conservative Party Conference 2018 was the special guest invited to introduce Prime Minister Theresa may.
